title: Add NgRx support to a module

name.description: Name of the NgRx feature (e.g., Products, Users, etc.). Recommended to use plural form for name.
name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the ngrx state?

module.description: Path to ngModule; host directory will contain the new '+state' directory (e.g., libs/comments/src/lib/comments-state.module.ts).
module.x-prompt: What is the path to the module where this ngrx state should be added to?

directory.description: Override the name of the folder used to contain/group the NgRx files: contains actions, effects, reducers. selectors. (e.g., +state)

root.description: Add StoreModule.forRoot and EffectsModule.forRoot() instead of forFeature (e.g., --root).
root.x-prompt: Is this the root state of the application?

facade.description: Create a Facade class for the the Feature (e.g., --facade).
facade.x-prompt: Would you like to add a Facade to your ngrx state

onlyAddFiles.description: Only add new NgRx files, without changing the module file (e.g., --onlyAddFiles).

onlyEmptyRoot.description: Do not generate any files. Only generate StoreModule.forRoot and EffectsModule.forRoot (e.g., --onlyEmptyRoot).

skipPackageJson.description: Do not add NgRx dependencies to package.json (e.g., --skipPackageJson)
